verbose_text: The alignment of the GDP-MPs from human, L. infantum and T. maritima showed that most of the residues of the bacterial enzyme active site are conserved between L. infantum and human, especially the E and K residues of the F (V) EKP motif which bind to the mannose and phosphate moieties of the substrate, respectively.
evidence: F(V)EKP motif which bind to the mannose
